summary: pre-weaning diarrhea is a syndrome affecting farm-raised neonatal mink kits. it causes greasy skin exudation, dehydration, and distressed behavior. no specific causative agents have been identified and the syndrome is regarded as multifactorial. significant increase in circulating concentrations of SAA was found in PWD affected mink kits from 6 to 23 days old compared to controls. the histopathological changes in PWD mink kits suggest that the type of diarrhea is secretory.
